summary: James P. Kelly was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCAS). He appears in payroll and certification reports from April 1978 to December 1978. The documents list his name, social security number, annual salary, and gross pay during the specified periods. The documents do not provide any specific details about his role or responsibilities within the committee.
significance: Based on the provided documents, James P. Kelly's significance lies in his employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations. The documents suggest he was a staff member during the committee's investigation, but his specific role and contribution to the investigation are not detailed.
